answers.answer: I'd go ahead and call just to be safe.

It never hurts to call and ask.  I have been having the stars and headaches but my blood pressure has been 110/60 the whole time.  Mine happens if it dips a little bit, if my blood sugar gets too low (no GD) or I move too fast.
Do you have access to a BP machine that you could test it yourself? just to make sure all is well... lots of pharmacys have them...

I did call and just mentioned my symptoms to a midwife and apparently its not a concern unless i get headaches that wont go away with painrelievers or other symptoms get worse or wont go away. Apparently seeing stars when getting into a shower(which is where it mostly happens for me) is pretty normal. I have been trying to get a hold of a bp monitor from friends or family just to keep an eye on it anyway but no luck yet. Its amazing how many things there are to worry about when theres a baby baking. Lol. Thanks ladies!

question: Hello, i am 34 weeks with #3. With #2 i had gestational diabetes but so far no problems with that again. However, lately ive been getting headaches and seeing little stars occasionally. I hear thats a sign of bad blood pressure. Ive been swelling a little but not abnormally. Does anyone know if this might be a sign of preeclampsia? Even without having gestatoonal,diabetes this time? Plan on telling my  doctor at next appt but thats a week away. Should i wait that long?
title: preeclampsia?
